resource.name: Authorizations From 10/01/2006 Thru 9/30/2022
resource.description:
NOTE: EXIM OPEN/Data.gov data is moving to Catalog.Data.gov! Data.EXIM.gov will cease operations effective 9/14/2023. User-generated datasets and visualizations will not be migrated to the new site however EXIM-provided data will be migrated in its entirety.

This file contains all authorizations approved between 10/01/2006 and 9/30/2022 Please note that the asterisked Working Capital transactions were extended during the period of EXIM Bank’s lapse in authority in conformance with original authorization agreements. These deals were originally authorized before the lapse as multiyear facilities with annual extensions. This record represents the extension of the prior authorization. EXIM did not authorize new business during its lapse in authority.
resource.attribution: Export Import Bank of the U.S
columns_description: The level of authority that made the decision on the deal.
The portion of an approved amount that assisted a woman owned company.
The difference between the Approved Amount and the Disbursed/Shipped Amount as of the date this data set was generated.
The amount of the loan or guarantee that has been disbursed or the amount that has been shipped on an insurance policy as of the date this data set was generated.
The primary borrower or guarantor responsible for repayment.
The company name of principal Borrower on a deal.
The state name of the Primary Exporter.
The city of the Primary Exporter.
The company name of principal Exporter on a deal.
The company name of principal Applicant on a deal. Note: for Working Capital Delegated Authority transactions the Primary Lender serves as the Primary Applicant for the Primary Exporter.
The financing program that was applied for.
The country where the credit risk is. This is typically the country of the buyer on a deal except for Working Capital guarantees or multibuyer insurance policies where the buyer is not known.
The expiration date for a guarantee or insurance policy.

For the insurance program, this is the effective date of an insurance policy. For guarantees and direct loans it is the operative date of the credit, and it is not applicable for Working Capital as the date is agreed upon between the delegated lender and the primary exporter.
The date of approval or denial.
A unique identifier attached to each deal.
Fiscal Year of the decision on a deal.
A generic description of the product that was exported.
A code for the insurance policy type. (Policy Type decryption is listed below this table.) Note: this only applies to the Insurance program.
A flag showing whether an insurance policy was brokered or not.
The deal identifier typically used in documents relating to a deal.
The asterisk (*) indicates that the deal shown is an extension of a previouslyapproved multi-year Working Capital facility.
The length of the financing on a deal.
Whether a deal was Approved or Declined
The interest rate being applied to a Direct Loan.
The portion of an approved amount that assisted a minority owned company.
The portion of an approved amount that assisted a small business.
The portion of the Disbursed/Shipped Amount that has not been repaid as of the date this data set was generated.
The amount of financing approved or declined.
A flag showing whether a Working Capital deal was decided under its' Delegated Authority program.
The state abbreviation of the Primary Exporter.
The company name of principal Lender on a deal.

The industry code of the product that was exported when reported to EXIM Bank. A Standard Industry Classification code (SIC) is 4 digits, whereas the North American Industry Classification System code (NAICS) is 6.
A flag showing if an approved transaction was cancelled after approval.

domain_metadata.value: Export Import Bank Office of Communications 202-565-3200
